server.name: Onchain Reputation Agent

endpoints.name: chain/trades/dna
endpoints.description: Fetches trades across the entire blockchain, with optional filtering by block range or timestamp range.

side.description: Specifies trade side for the given token_address.

dna.description: Pipe-delimited list of walletDNA metrics to return in the response. Use 'all' to display every metric. Default: all. Valid options include: tokens, intelligence, reputation, flow, mass, epoch, makerPresence, entry, all. Example: intelligence|flow|mass|tokens

min_usd.description: Minimum trade size in USD. Filters out trades with an estimated USD value below this threshold. Calculated using on-chain price data at the time of the trade. Note: Adds additional SLAM cost to the query. A maximum of 10,000 trades that would otherwise match this query will be scanned.

max_usd.description: Maximum trade size in USD. Filters out trades with an estimated USD value above this threshold. Calculated using on-chain price data at the time of the trade. Note: Adds additional SLAM cost to the query. A maximum of 10,000 trades that would otherwise match this query will be scanned.

min_iq.description: Minimum holder IQ (raw score). Filters out wallets with IQ scores below this threshold. Average IQ for all wallets trading a given token is 100.

max_iq.description: Maximum holder IQ (raw score). Filters out wallets with IQ scores above this threshold. Average IQ for all wallets trading a given token is 100. Max: Although possible, it is uncommon for wallets to have IQ scores above 200

min_intelligence.description: Minimum holder Intelligence tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_intelligence.description: Maximum holder Intelligence tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_reputation.description: Minimum raw holder Reputation. Filters out wallets with Reputation scores below this threshold.

max_reputation.description: Maximum raw holder Reputation. Filters out wallets with Reputation scores above this threshold. Max: 100

min_reputation_tier.description: Minimum holder Reputation tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_reputation_tier.description: Maximum holder Reputation tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_mass.description: Minimum raw holder Mass. Filters out wallets with Mass scores below this threshold.

max_mass.description: Maximum raw holder Mass. Filters out wallets with Mass scores above this threshold. Max: Scores above 250 are rare but possible.

min_mass_tier.description: Minimum holder Mass tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_mass_tier.description: Maximum holder Mass tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_epoch.description: Minimum raw holder Epoch. Filters out wallets with Epoch scores below this threshold.

max_epoch.description: Maximum raw holder Epoch. Filters out wallets with Epoch scores above this threshold. Max: 200

min_epoch_tier.description: Minimum holder Epoch tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_epoch_tier.description: Maximum holder Epoch tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_maker_presence.description: Minimum raw holder maker_presence. Filters out wallets with maker_presence scores below this threshold.

max_maker_presence.description: Maximum raw holder maker_presence. Filters out wallets with maker_presence scores above this threshold. Max: Scores above 200 are rare but possible.

min_maker_presence_tier.description: Minimum holder maker_presence tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_maker_presence_tier.description: Maximum holder maker_presence tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_flow.description: Minimum raw holder Flow. Filters out wallets with Flow scores below this threshold.

max_flow.description: Maximum raw holder Flow. Filters out wallets with Flow scores above this threshold. Max: Scores above 250 are rare but possible.

min_flow_tier.description: Minimum holder Flow tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_flow_tier.description: Maximum holder Flow tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_buy_flow.description: Minimum raw holder min_buy_flow. Filters out wallets with buy_flow scores below this threshold.

max_buy_flow.description: Maximum raw holder buy_flow. Filters out wallets with buy_flow scores above this threshold. Max: Scores above 250 are rare but possible.

min_buy_flow_tier.description: Minimum holder buy_flow tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_buy_flow_tier.description: Maximum holder buy_flow tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

min_sell_flow.description: Minimum raw holder sell_flow. Filters out wallets with sell_flow scores below this threshold.

max_sell_flow.description: Maximum raw holder sell_flow. Filters out wallets with sell_flow scores above this threshold. Max: Scores above 250 are rare but possible.

min_sell_flow_tier.description: Minimum holder sell_flow tier. Filters out wallets ranked below this tier.

max_sell_flow_tier.description: Maximum holder sell_flow tier. Filters out wallets ranked above this tier.

num.description: The maximum number of trade records to return. Maximum: 1000.

order.description: Sort order for results: asc (oldest first) or desc (newest first).

start_timestamp.description: Start searching from this UTC timestamp (inclusive). If provided, overrides start_block as the starting point.

start_block.description: Block number to start the search from (inclusive). Defaults to the latest block in desc order, or the genesis block in asc order.

start_log_index.description: Log index within the starting block to resume pagination or refine the starting point.

estimate_cost.description: When true returns the SLAM token cost for this query. It does not return any data or incur any actual charges.

slam.description: The SLAM token cost for this API call.

chain.description: The name of the blockchain network (e.g., base).

start_block.description: The block number at which to continue fetching results.

start_log_index.description: The log index within the block at which to continue.

trades.description: List of token trade records matching the query.

utc.description: UTC timestamp of the transaction (ISO 8601 format).

log_index.description: Log index for this transfer within the block.

side.description: The side of the trade: "buy" or "sell", relative to the trader.

usd.description: The USD value of the trade at the time of execution.

amount.description: The amount of the token exchanged (normalized by token decimals).
The amount of the token exchanged (normalized by token decimals).

price.description: The execution price expressed as quoteToken per baseToken.

address.description: The pair or pool contract address (V2/V3) or creation transaction hash (V4).

labels.description: Additional tags or labels describing the pair.

name.description: A human-readable label for the address (if available).

labels.description: Additional tags or labels describing the address.

balance.description: Current wallet balance of the token.

staked.description: Net amount transferred to a staking contract.

supply_pct.description: Percentage of the token's total supply held.

staked_pct.description: Percentage of the wallet's token balance transferred to a staking contract.

value_usd.description: USD value of the token holdings.

balance.description: Current wallet balance of the token.

staked.description: Net amount transferred to a staking contract.

supply_pct.description: Percentage of the token's total supply held.

staked_pct.description: Percentage of the wallet's token balance transferred to a staking contract.

value_usd.description: USD value of the token holdings.

method.description: How the wallet initially received the token (e.g., "DEX", "Airdrop", "Transfer")

parent.description: Address of the immediate parent wallet/contract that transferred tokens to this wallet.

grand_parent.description: Address of the upstream source two levels back in the transfer chain.

great_grand_parent.description: Address of the upstream source three levels back in the transfer chain.

name.description: A human-readable label for the address (if available).

labels.description: Additional tags or labels describing the address.

address.description: The address that invoked the pool’s swap function (event sender); often a router, aggregator, or other contract executing the swap.

name.description: A human-readable label for the address (if available).

labels.description: Additional tags or labels describing the address.

address.description: The address designated to receive output tokens in the swap event (Uniswap V2: event to; Uniswap V3: event recipient). May be an intermediary contract.

name.description: A human-readable label for the address (if available).

labels.description: Additional tags or labels describing the address.

endpoints.name: api/bestmove
endpoints.description: Request a recommended move for an American checkers position using the specified PDN and search depth.

pdn.description: Checkers position in PDN/FEN short form (e.g. W:W31,32:B1-4). Prefix selects side to move, use K for kings.

depth.description: Search depth override between 1 and 12. Higher depth increases accuracy and latency. Numeric strings are coerced if provided.

bestMove.description: Suggested move in long algebraic notation (e.g., 22x17x10).

evaluation.description: Evaluation in hundredths of a man from the side to move.

depth.description: Search depth used for the analysis.

pdn.description: Echo of the analyzed PDN position.

principalVariation.description: Principal variation predicted by the engine.

server.name: api.x402checkers.com

endpoints.name: montages
endpoints.description: Create and manage montages of audio visual media.

audio.description: Audio reference. Provide either an existing assetId fetched earlier or a HTTPS URL we can download (meaning the URL ends in .mp4 and is actually an mp4). The multipart form supports an 'audio' file field instead.

url.description: Direct HTTPS URL to fetch the audio from (signed URLs are recommended; Drive/Dropbox share pages will fail).

filename.description: Optional filename to persist when staging the audio object.

contentType.description: Optional MIME type override for the audio download.

videos.description: List of video references. Each entry may reuse an assetId or provide a direct HTTPS URL we can download. The multipart form accepts repeated 'videos' file fields.

url.description: Direct HTTPS URL to fetch the video from (signed URLs recommended; must stream raw media).

filename.description: Optional filename to persist when staging the video object.

contentType.description: Optional MIME type override for the video download.

prompt.description: Optional creative brief (<=1000 characters) passed to the AI planner.

username.description: Optional display name (<=50 characters). Used for job tracking and output naming.

jobId.description: Identifier for the queued montage. Poll GET /jobs/{jobId} until status=succeeded to obtain the CDN URL.

audioAssetId.description: Staged audio asset identifier. Use it in future montage calls or GET /assets to inspect metadata.

videoAssetIds.description: Staged video asset identifiers, matching the order of the submitted clips.

server.description: Ecliptic is an intelligent audio visual media editor that allows you to create and edit audio visual media with ease.
